Sections.SectionDescription: INFO: You must reload a (quick) save to apply all settings in this mod.

Settings.Name: Use MCM Settings
Settings.Tooltip: Enable or disable the use of MCM settings
Settings.Description:
Enable or disable the use of MCM settings. If disabled, the combatextender.json
config will be used, otherwise it will be overwritten by the MCM settings.

Settings.Name: Global Health Multiplier
Settings.Tooltip: A health multiplier applied to all enemies/bosses before any other calculations.
Settings.Description:
All enemies and bosses will have their max HP values multiplied by this value
before any other scaling is applied. Use this to set the base HP numbers that
all other multipliers should be applied to. Set this to 1.0 for Balanced
difficulty HP levels, 1.3 for Tactician, or whatever other base scaling you'd
prefer.

Settings.Name: Health Multiplier Party Scaling
Settings.Tooltip: Scale health based on the size of the party
Settings.Description:
All allies, enemies, and bosses will have their health scaled by this value
multiplied by the number of characters in the party. Setting this value to 0
disables this feature.

---                      ALLIES                      ---

Settings.Name: Enable Allies Health Overrides
Settings.Tooltip: Enable this to use the custom health settings for allies.
Settings.Description:
If checked, allies will have their health scaled by custom values defined below.
If unchecked, allies will have their health scaled by the values used for enemies.

Settings.Name: Allies Base Health Multiplier
Settings.Tooltip: Base health multiplier for allies.

Settings.Name: Allies Health Multiplier Per Level
Settings.Tooltip: Health multiplier increase per level for allies.

Settings.Name: Bosses Base Health Multiplier
Settings.Tooltip: Base health multiplier for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Health Multiplier Per Level
Settings.Tooltip: Health multiplier increase per level for bosses.

Settings.Name: Enemies Base Health Multiplier
Settings.Tooltip: Base health multiplier for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Health Multiplier Per Level
Settings.Tooltip: Health multiplier increase per level for enemies.
Settings.Description:
These values adjust the scaling of ally, enemy, and boss health pools. These
multipliers are applied on top of the global multiplier at the top of this
section. The calculation is:
health = (balancedDifficultyHealth * globalHealthMultiplier) * (baseMult + (perLevelMult * playerPartyLevel))

Settings.Name: Bosses Base Damage Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base damage boost for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Damage Boost Per Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Damage boost per level increment for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Damage Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based boss damage boost.

Settings.Name: Enemies Base Damage Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base damage boost for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Damage Boost Per Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Damage boost per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Damage Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy damage boost.
Settings.Description:
These values increase the damage dealt by enemies and bosses. The calculation is:
damageBoost = baseDamageBoost + (damageBoostPerIncrement * math.floor(targetLevel / levelIncrement))
The floor value of a number is the value that is rounded to the closest integer less than or equal to that integer.
Example with a level 5 target: totalBoost = 1 + 1 * (5 / 4) = 2

Settings.Name: Bosses Base Armour Class Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base armor class boost for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Armour Class Boost Per Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Armor class boost per level increment for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Armour Class Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based boss armor class boost.

Settings.Name: Enemies Base Armour Class Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base armor class boost for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Armour Class Boost Per Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Armor class boost per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Armour Class Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy armor class boost.
Settings.Description: Refer to the Damage Section description

Settings.Name: Bosses Spell Save DC Static Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base spell save DC boost for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Spell Save DC Boost Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Spell Save DC boost per level increment for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Spell Save DC Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based boss spell save DC boost.

Settings.Name: Enemies Spell Save DC Static Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base spell save DC boost for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Spell Save DC Boost Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Spell Save DC boost per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Spell Save DC Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy spell save DC boost.
Settings.Description: Refer to the Damage Section description

Settings.Name: Bosses Ability Points Static Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base ability point boost for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Ability Points Boost Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Ability point boost per level increment for bosses.

Settings.Name: Bosses Ability Points Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based boss ability point boost.

Settings.Name: Enemies Ability Points Static Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Base ability point boost for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Ability Points Boost Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Ability point boost per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Ability Points Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy ability point boost.
Settings.Description:
I sort enemy abilities by value to find the top 2, and check if
SpellCastingAbility is one of those. If SpellCastingAbility is not among
the top 2, I add it to the list of abilities to boost. In most
situations you will see 2 abilities being boosted, but sometimes 3.
Furthermore I ensure the final ability value is an even number, rounded
up from what it would have been.

Settings.Name: Boss Movement Speed Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Flat movement speed boost for bosses.

Settings.Name: Enemy Movement Speed Boost
Settings.Tooltip: Flat movement speed boost for enemies.

Settings.Name: Bosses Additional Action

Settings.Name: Bosses Saving Throw Level Increment

Settings.Name: Enemies Attack Roll Static Bonus
Settings.Tooltip: Base attack roll bonus for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Attack Roll Bonus Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Attack roll bonus per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Attack Roll Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy attack roll boost.

Settings.Name: Enemies Saving Throw Static Bonus
Settings.Tooltip: Base saving throw bonus for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Saving Throw Bonus Per Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Saving throw bonus per level increment for enemies.

Settings.Name: Enemies Saving Throw Level Increment
Settings.Tooltip: Level increment for level-based enemy saving throw boost.
Settings.Description:
Refering to saving throw settings: These apply to any saving throw. Use
this to increase the floor. However primarily use AbilityPoints boosts
to keep targets unique.

Settings.Name: Act 1 Spells
Settings.Tooltip: Spells available in Act 1 for Barbarian.

Settings.Name: Act 1 Extra Passives
Settings.Tooltip: Extra passives available in Act 1 for Barbarian.

Settings.Name: Act 2 Spells
Settings.Tooltip: Spells available in Act 2 for Barbarian.

Settings.Name: Act 2 Extra Passives
Settings.Tooltip: Extra passives available in Act 2 for Barbarian.

Settings.Name: Act 3 Spells
Settings.Tooltip: Spells available in Act 3 for Barbarian.

Settings.Name: Act 3 Extra Passives
Settings.Tooltip: Extra passives available in Act 3 for Barbarian.
Settings.Description:
Combat Extender (CX) is built around tagging enemies based on their
archetypes and using those tags to configure their abilities, spells,
and passives. The tagging process was done manually over a significant
amount of time. If you spot any mistakes in-game, please let me know!
You can also add passives, spells, and abilities from other mods, but
make sure to load those mods before CX.

The configuration allows you to set up difficulty per act using the Act
separator. Act configuration is cumulative, meaning Act 3 includes the
configurations from Act 1, Act 2, and Act 3.

 For example, in the configuration for the Barbarian class:
-In Act 1, only spells are given without additional passives.
- In Act 2, additional passives are provided without new spells.
- In Act 3, more passives are added.

The configuration supports missing entries for certain acts. For
instance, if there is no entry for Act 2, the configuration will still
be cumulative, combining the settings from Act 1 and Act 3.

Regarding missing classes, some classes are very rare in the game. Most
spellcasters are wizards, and there are only a handful of sorcerers,
such as characters like Mizora. Because they are so rare, they already
have all the abilities and spells they should have.

Settings.Name: Extra Spell Slots (Level 1)

Settings.Description:
These passives were assigned during the manual tagging process following
vanilla rules. This means you will never see level 5 (CX_Spells_L5) in
Act 1.

Settings.Name: Use Level Scaling
Settings.Tooltip: Enable or disable level scaling.
Settings.Description:
WARNING: Do not use level scaling unless you know what you need it for!
---                      CHARACTERS                      ---

Settings.Name: Characters Act 1 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for characters in Act 1.

Settings.Name: Characters Act 1 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for characters in Act 1.

Settings.Name: Characters Act 2 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for characters in Act 2.

Settings.Name: Characters Act 2 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for characters in Act 2.

Settings.Name: Characters Act 3 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for characters in Act 3.

Settings.Name: Characters Act 3 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for characters in Act 3.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 1 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for bosses in Act 1.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 1 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for bosses in Act 1.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 2 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for bosses in Act 2.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 2 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for bosses in Act 2.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 3 Max Level
Settings.Tooltip: Max level for bosses in Act 3.

Settings.Name: Bosses Act 3 Offset
Settings.Tooltip: Level offset for bosses in Act 3.
Settings.Description:
This is the level scaling part, this is not in the vanilla configuration,
and it will never be. The calculation is: take player level,
apply (optional) offset, if the value is under or equal to max
value, set target to this level. Max means max, targets will never get
leveled beyond this value. Nobody will ever get down leveled unless you
run the reset configuration. The original levels of targets are stored
in your save file. 

 We do not differentiate between allies or enemies here,
 levels are just a number in this game for NPCs. If your configuration is
 similar to the default one and doesn't give any stats boosts to allies
 the end result will be identical.
